tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,
review: *** ** *** **** ****** ** *** ***** *** ** **** ************* *** one can blindly follow her recommendation and treatment. My wife had multiple abortion and critical problem in progression of pregnancy. We visited multiple doctors in the city but no one can find root cause of the problem. She is the one who found the issue at first visit it's self and given confidence to us. She brought happiness in our life through our kid. Usually I don't write any reviews but I am writing this because others can benefit from it. God bless her.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,
review:
We have been consulting Dr Poornima Gouda in Cloundnine, Whitefield, Bangalore, since early pregnancy, Oct’20, and delivered our second baby on July 14th’21. Both Mom and kid are doing good without any complications. Thanks to Dr Poornima for supporting the Normal delivery as per our wish. However overall our experience at cloudnine Whitefield was horrible and I am listing a few instances here,

Nurses – The capability of supporting nurses is not up to the expectations per our experience, an example - the nurses did not bother to connect the NST device properly (that checks the baby heartbeat and pain before labour) until I noticed and informed them.
The nurses did not come at regular time/ or instruct upfront on the medications, a few time we had to call them to check (like tablets to take before food/after food)
The Duty doctor was very arrogant (on duty 13th Jul’21 nigh) – When we enquired if my wife could get Epidural because the pain at some point was intolerable, she commented sarcastically like you want a normal delivery without any pain huh?
The nurse as well apparently told duty doctor that we have been telling them how to use the devices (from point#1) the duty doctor then shouted at me & my wife that nurses know how to use devices better than us et.al, It would have made some sense if duty doctor had the mind to understood the problem that we tried to point out about the nurses..
The duty doctor also mentioned that she has been tired of treating many patient throughout night.. however for us it’s our only baby and delivery for lifetime, if she is tired of work she should probably inform her superior doctors et.al and not use the patient /my wife to relive all the anger, who is been at the peak of labor, just for asking if epidural could be administered!!
The duty doctor than called the gynecologist(Dr. Poornima gowda) and told that we are demanding for epidural et.al which we never did (we did enquire but did NOT demand), obviously she was trying to make some points on her side..
After the delivery my wife was still in tears because of the way the duty doctor mentally harassed her while she was in labor room..
It was not over yet.. the nurses gave bath to my wife in cold water(at 6:30am), when she said the water is very cold, the nurse threw the mug away and kept her waiting.. can’t further describe..
Yes, as patients we may ask more questions in a critical time(because it’s one time instance in life and the fear of unknowns) but it was the responsibility of the doctor to handle and not yell/scold the patient at that time.
I still respect the work the duty doctor did along with Gynecologist and delivered our kid through normal delivery but I believe that does not entitle them to treat us the way they want or the mood they are in..
We had our first kid delivered at ovum hospital which was a very pleasant experience throughout and we had to choose Cloudnine hospital this time because we relocated to Whitefield, A decision that we will regret for lifetime..

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,
context: Pregnancy Check Up,High-Risk Pregnancy Care,Complicated Pregnancy Treatment,
review: Dr.Poornima is one of the high professional doctor we have seen in Bangalore . She looked into complete medical history one by one and helped us to understand all our details. I already had 3 miscarriages and quite trashed with it. I decided to go ahead another time and this time also in 7th week bleeding started, really emotionally challenging and breakdown situation. We rush to the hospital and loose all hope but by god's grace that day first time we booked appointment of Poornima mam. She listened me very patiently and understood my previous history and accordingly started my treatment. She explained very well why particular medicine and injections needs to be taken - how it will help along with tests (which we understood was quite important to minimize the complication) since my pregnancy was a high risk pregnancy with many complications. During pregnancy term, I faced lots of issues in 5th month with my placenta being low lying. In 7 months, Jaundice symptoms started which affected my whole body to itchy all the time but mam did not recommend any unwanted medicine and handled it very naturally. Considering all situations and due to high-risk pregnancy, my delivery was planned for the C- section and it was due on 11th Jan’22 but my water ruptured in 35 week 5 days. Mam waited to get pain started if I can deliver normal and she tried her best and my planned C section turned into Normal delivery. We are blessed with a baby girl on 6th Dec'21 and with all healthy vitals condition post-delivery. NO NICU required (which we were scared off). All thanks to Poornima Mam *** ** **** * *** ****** ** *** God Bless

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
context: Pregnancy Check Up,High-Risk Pregnancy Care,Complicated Pregnancy Treatment,
review:
*********** ***** ** *** ** *** **** ************ ******* She explains all the medical history one by one and helps us to understand all our issues or medical history properly that made us feel more comfortable and gave us confidence. My wife was detected with a rare genetic condition that accelerates blood clots and blocks the blood flow to the placenta. We lost our first pregnancy in 8th Month due to this reason which we did not know at that point in time. Things became clear after a prothrombin panel test which showed an MTHFR gene mutation. During the second pregnancy, Started with Lonopin dosage daily for blood thinner throughout the pregnancy. She was very caring, friendly, approachable and very patient in listening to any type of queries and responded it in details with pros and cons. She always answers to your queries with smiling face and also she will make sure you are satisfied with her clarifications. 

All pre and post natal advices were given by her which she explained very well. Highly recommend her to everyone for pregnancy or high risk pregnancy consultation.

tags: Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review: We consulted Dr Poornima Gowda for my wife's 2nd pregnancy for the whole pregnancy term. Everything was going good till her 38 weeks of pregnancy except the Doctor was never on time 90% of the time and she never checks the history of the previous visit and the form which we need to fill before 15 minutes of your appointment. *** ** **** ***** ** ******** ******* ** *** ******** *** ******** **** ** ****** *** ******** *** * ****** ******** ******* * ******** On her 39th week scan i.e., on Monday 24th May, she said that she messed up with my wife's case history and asked her to take RT PCR test for Covid and plan for an elective C section delivery on 29th May. My wife gave her RT PCR samples at Cloudnine Whitefield at around 12:30 pm on 24th May. We got her report on 25th May afternoon as Covid positive with 26.5 ct value which was completely unbelievable for us as we had not gone out of our home since last 1 month. Then, we got a call from Cloudnine CRM and she told that since my wife is Covid positive, there will be extra charges for the delivery which is somewhere around 20k  . ** *********** ****** ** **** **** *** ******** ** ****** ** **** ***** ***** *** ** ** ****** ******** ** ****** *** ***** ******** ************* We video consulted the Dr on the same day and she told to postpone the delivery by at least 10 days. We took one more test for my wife, 3.5 years old daughter and me through SRL lab on Wednesday morning and we all were Covid negative. We consulted the doctor again and this time she told they will consider my wife still Covid positive to be on the safer side but she told to hurry up for the delivery and do it as per the plan i.e., on 29th May. We called the Cloudnine CRM and told her that we got negative reports now and we will not come to Cloudnine hospital for the delivery ** ** ***** ****** ** ***** ** *** ******* ** *********** ******* *** ********** ******** ****** ***** *** ******* **** **** ** ** ***** *** *** *** **** ** *********** **** **** **** **** **** ******** ** **** ** ***** ******** ***** ** **** ***** *** *** ** *** **** **** ** ******** **** *** *** *** *** ******** ****** *** ** ***** **** *** **** ***** ** **** ********* ****** ****** **** ** ******** **** *** ***** *** ** *** ** ** *** ** ********* * ******* ******** *** *** ** ****** **** *** ** *********** ** **** *** ** **** ***** ***** *** ** *** **** ** ******* ********** ** ****** ******** *** *** * ******* ******** **** *** ** ***** **** **** ******** ********* * ** *** ********* *** ****** *** ********* ******** ** ******* **** * ***** ** *** ****** ** ****** ******* ** *******
reply_text:
Let's get the facts correct. Based on my experience of conducting vaginal delivery after a C section and as your wife was keen for vaginal delivery we waited till 38 weeks. As she developed gestational diabetes in the 9 th month, decided to proceed with an elective C section. As per the protocol Covid test was done. As she was already in the 39th week, we decided to proceed as per the planned date despite her Covid status. There was neither hurrying for delivery nor messing up of history as you are mentioning. Of course we wanted to take all Covid safety precautions as safety of healthcare professionals is also important. Let's not forget that this thing happened when 2nd wave of Covid was peaking in Bangalore and several hundred doctors & nurses in this country had already died due to pandemic. 


Regarding your comment on sticking to timelines, most of the time we are dealing with unscheduled emergencies and patients requiring extra care / time, which could delay OPD timings. Even if I start late sometimes, I never compromise on the care & attention given to individual patients.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,
review:
We are consulting Dr. Poornima M Gowda at Cloudnine Whitefield, Bengaluru for my wife’s first pregnancy. We opted Cloudnine for initial consultation and scanning and were planning to go to my wife’s hometown for delivery. After few consultation, we changed our mind to go with Cloudnine for delivery. Dr.Poornima M Gowda really made us feel more comfortable and gave us confidence which made us change our decision. Doctor and the supporting staff humbly answered all our questions related to pregnancy even if we have asked n number of times. On the day of delivery,  my wife started getting labor pain at 11am in the morning, Dr.Poornima did wait patiently till evening to deliver the baby through normal delivery. 

Though we were in the peak of second wave of pandemic during our second trimester, hospital has made all necessary arrangements to feel more safe. 

Overall we had a wonderful experience at Cloudnine and with Dr.Poornima. I would highly recommend Dr.Poornima and Cloudnine whitefield for the kind of treatment they provide and the professionalism that they follow.

tags: Wait time,
context: Pregnancy Check Up,PCOD/PCOS Treatment,Pre and Post Delivery Care,Caesarean Section (C Section),
review: Our pregnancy story was complicated and if it wasn’t for Dr. Poornima’s constant guidance and vigilance we would not have our baby boy today. I was detected with a rare genetic condition that accelerates blood clots and blocks the blood flow to the placenta. We lost our first pregnancy due to this reason which we did not know at that point in time. Things became clear after a prothrombin panel test which showed an MTHFR gene mutation. During the second pregnancy, I was put on a daily dosage of blood thinner throughout the term. Towards the third-trimester things got even more complicated with restless leg syndrome (RLS) that is caused due to low Ferritin levels, Pruritic urticarial papules and plaques of pregnancy (PUPPP) rash that caused a severe allergic reaction around the belly, and obstructive cholestasis that causes a severe itch around the leg. Through all of these difficulties, we could persevere because of Dr. Poornima’s, patience, ability to go to the root of the problems quickly and advising appropriate medical supervision. Her pleasant and calm demeneour always gave us confidence.  Due to the high-risk nature of this pregnancy, we went for C-Sec and were blessed with our child. Looking back the journey was certainly scary but this seemingly impossible journey was possible only because of Dr. Poornima. We can't express our gratitude enough for the happiness that we have with us today.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,
review:
The Doctor is an amazing person with a smile always on the face and very friendly with the patient and keen explanation about health issues and betterment.
I am diabetic from 1yr before I conceived and choose only Dr.Poornima Gowda after hearing about her great work and also seeing my sister in law recovering quick after delivery and I am 100% satisfied with her treatment and delivery which was c-section with a minimal pain and quick healing and the most important thing has been me and baby being healthy after delivery.Many thanks to her from all of our family members.Thanks Cloudnine.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review:
I had the genetic issue in my previous pregnancy and had undergone so much pain and depression.  Then we consulted this doctor Poornima Gowda, who clearly examined our case and gave us a hope of becoming a parent again. she treated our case with a extra care and love., guided us in each and every stage ,starting from conceiving , genetic testing till the delivery,and finally with gods grace we were blessed with a healthy baby.. 

Finally I would like to thank this doctor for every thing, I really like the way she handles the patient..

*** ** *** *** ******* **** **** ********
 Thank you doctor. It means a lot to us. 

With love 
Pooja & Ratan

tags: Treatment satisfaction,
review:
We had pregnancy confirmed in month of April and visited Whitefield hospital, we were assigned to Dr. Poornima and to our luck, we need to ask many questions as doctor explained everything herself in sequential manner of each trimester. Diagnosed with Gestational Diabetes, but on doctors recommendation treated it with diet and no medicine. In month of December we are finally with our baby delivered normally.

Would highly recommend Dr. Poornima for those looking for natural way of treatment with only mandatory medicines.

Thanks Dr. Poornima for all your support and patience.

Regards
Pooja

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review:
We had our first appointment with Dr. Poornima Ma'am in the month of April. 
At first, we had many doubts and queries about pregnancy (since it was our first baby). But after our first visit to the Doctor, all the things were sorted out and started to take its place, in a smooth way.
The rapport built by the Doctor in the beginning,  took us in a very gentle and pleasent manner throughout the journey of my pregnancy. 
During the course of delivery, Doctor Ma'am gave me that confidence and prepared me mentally and physically, for everything to be normal.
On the penultimate day, I gave birth (normal delivery) to a healthy baby and I am very much grateful to Dr. Ma'am..
Thank You Dr. Poornima Ma'am for all the confidence and support, during this journey.
We definitely recommend Dr. Poornima for the pregnancy check ups and related issues.
- Geetha M M

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,
review: We just contacted Cloudnine and we booked for Dr Poornima ma’am in the month Apr 2021. We came for pregnancy check and scan. But I had a pre term baby which was delivered for 29 weeks. To speak about Dr Poornima ma’am, she was so friendly and so helpful * ************* and also made us understand about all the situation so calmly. It was nothing that she took a decision to deliver the baby soon since I came to the hospital with pain. She waited for the labour pain to reduce and she did the normal delivery only. Everything went normal and fine and they took care of me so well of all the days I stayed. Would recommend Dr Poornima ma’am any pregnancy related issues. Once again thanks to her for my journey with cloudnine.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,
review:
*** ******** ** *** ** *** **** ************* ***** treats her patients like family. You will always feel secure and safe, during those 9 months of pregnancy. 
She helped us to stay calm and stress free during our pregnancy inspite of the complications we faced. 
She helped us to go for NVD inspite of my very high BP and sugar levels and she made sure to relieve all my stress during delivery. My words really can't express my gratitude for her,  she is the best with superb expertise and with very rich experience. I would highly recommend her to have stressfree pregnancy and delivery

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review: We have been consulting Dr Poornima Gowda for my 1st pregnancy. I was referred by many people that Dr Poornima is the best doctor and I really experienced it during my checkups and delivery. Everything she did very smoothly even during delivery if there is any risk or if it is critical she takes cake of things very carefully and smoothly. She gave us confidence and explained the health issues properly. We really had a very good experience with doctor. I would highly recommend Dr Poornima for pregnancy check ups and Cloudnine hospital as well for their professionalism and the kind of treatment they provide.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,
review: I have been seeing Dr. Poornima from the day I have conceived my first baby. I always felt positive after meeting doctor. The concerns I use to have during my pregnancy were well taken care as doctor use to explain the reason and solution to those. At the time of admission the on duty doctor was in regular touch with Dr Poornima. There were few complications which surfaced at the last minute due to which doctor had to do Cesarean section and everything was well handle and coordinated. We can't thank enough to Dr Poornima as under her care and supervisor everything went well. We consulted her post delivery as well and following her advise I have recovered really fast.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,
review:
My pregnancy was a dream till I met Dr Poornima Gowda. After having 5 miss carriages I had lost hope .After getting positive result in Jan I rushed to cloudnine and met doctor Poornima gowda , post studying my previous case history she acted swiftly and suggested few tests , post which I learnt about NP cells deficiency - which was the major cause for my previous miscarriages.
Dr Poornima started immediate medications and helped me retain this pregnancy through personal vigilance and commitment.

Of not her we wouldn't have had our little angel in our life after 14years of marriage.

Heartfelt gratitude and thanks to Dr Poornima Gowda for bringing in this happiness in our life's.
She holds the best place in our hearts for ever.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,
review:
HIGH RISK PREGNANCY and NORMAL DELIVERY
I visited Dr Poornima m gowda for my second pregnancy.  Throughout the pregnancy she was very caring and helpful. I had high BP and reduced fluid around the baby, and even though it was my second delivery I was very apprehensive and wanted caesarean. But madam was so supportive and confident that I would deliver normally, and indeed I had a normal vaginal Delivery, and now both of us are healthy and happy. Thank you madam for easing out my pregnancy and delivery. *** *** *** *****

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,
context: Labor and Delivery,Pregnancy Check Up,Pregnancy care and management,Normal Vaginal Delivery (NVD),Pre and Post Delivery Care,
review: Poornima ma'am was a blessing for me throughout my pregnancy. Due to covid, my family was not able to stay with us due to personal challenges. But Poornima ma'am's regular guidance during consultations and positivity helped me sail through. She advocates using natural methods and avoids prescribing medicines and tests unless required. She also explains very beautifully and a very good listener. Another good attribute which impressed me was, she relates how our ancestors used to handle pregnancy and childbirth and not everything which is considered advanced today is required or necessary. Finally, I had a normal delivery and the whole process was very smooth. My husband and I were also kept in the loop regarding all the progress and updates during the delivery process. She also kept encouraging and guiding me during my post-partum phase. Very thankful to her for everything.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,
review: We consulted Dr Poirnima for my 1st pregnancy.if I consider god I can see, she is for me. Very friendly, to the point, and positive attitude. tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,
review:
We consulted Dr.Poornima Gowda for our second baby. We had a gap of 10 years after our first baby. she looked at our previous history and was given us great guidance to make the pregnancy happy and confident. All necessary precautions were advised and we are happy to get a healthy baby after 38 weeks.
Dr.Poornina Gowda is very friendly keeping a smile in her face which always gives us a positive energy. She explains everything very clearly and feed us with lot of confidence. 
She is well experienced. 
We wish Dr. Poornima Gowda all the very best and may God bless.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,
review:
We believe that these 9 months are very precious and one always wants them the best as anything can go wrong at any point. So it is very important at this time to have good support, especially from the doctors
After doing enough research on best gynaecologist in Bangalore, we finally decided to go with Dr. Poornima Gowda for my pregnancy at cloudnine Whitefield hospital.

I gave birth to beautiful baby girl via normal delivery. I and my family is extremely thankful to Dr Poornima madam, who is highly expert in her domain and practices all the advanced technologies.

The Best part about Dr. Poornima madam is, at first she tries to cure medical issues with diet and lifestyle over medication.

At the same time she is very humble, welcoming and politely answers all your doubts.

We strongly recommend to blindly go with Dr. Poornima Gowda.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review:
Hello Guys, For us Dr. Poornima is not less then GOD.She saved our life and full filled it with happiness. I would say the best doctor in banglore. Because of B - ve second pregnancy our baby got anaemic in 7th month as ict test came positive and that time baby weight was only 1.5 kg then we were thinking about that we should go for delivery or not. But she helped and did the treatment and send us for the treatment in bfmc. Where they did the treatment and we passed the 8th month successfully and baby weight was 2.49 kg. Then in the 9th month is starting my wife water bag was broken then She suggested  us that. Now time has come and we can deliver the baby. No anemia symptoms and baby is healthy. So we blessed with a healthy baby boy. This happened because of the dr Poornima. My wife case was so much complex but she handled it very easily. Thank you Doctor.. so much love and blessings from our side. 
Details: 
Nitin Goyal* **********
Ayushi Goyal * **********
